channel.title: Final Fantasy Swords
channel.description:
[B][size=5]Buster Sword[/size][/B] [IMG]http://i890.photobucket.com/albums/ac104/lazyness_net/wow.jpg[/img]
[B][size=5]Ripper[/size][/B] [IMG]http://i890.photobucket.com/albums/ac104/lazyness_net/wow4.jpg[/img]
[B][size=5]Murasame[/size][/B] [IMG]http://i890.photobucket.com/albums/ac104/lazyness_net/wow2.jpg[/img]
[B][size=5]Ultima[/size][/B] [IMG]http://i890.photobucket.com/albums/ac104/lazyness_net/wow5.jpg[/img]
Love? Hate? Rate? Is there anything that I need to fix on these?

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

the wanderer:

Okay first off… Your talking about copyright infringement when this is a RuneScape Private Server community. Made me lul a bit Javafire. And tracing means drawing splines and the creating faces onto these splines and making your object three-dimensional. Using primitives over top of a image is not tracing, but called using a reference. This is used in a lot of high tech games such as Call of Duty Black Ops. They use this method when making guns and people to make sure they are as realistic as possible. They don’t draw a gun, they take pictures of guns and people. Nothing wrong with using references.

Agreed, and I never thought of using a reference for primitives, that’s a great idea

Read full topic

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Okay first off… Your talking about copyright infringement when this is a RuneScape Private Server community. Made me lul a bit Javafire. And tracing means drawing splines and the creating faces onto these splines and making your object three-dimensional. Using primitives over top of a image is not tracing, but called using a reference. This is used in a lot of high tech games such as Call of Duty Black Ops. They use this method when making guns and people to make sure they are as realistic as possible. They don’t draw a gun, they take pictures of guns and people. Nothing wrong with using references.

Nice for your first work, but try to use primitives.

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

[quote=“Javafire, post:34, topic:374668”][quote author=Lazyness link=topic=470628.msg3442521#msg3442521 date=1293164469]

my intelligence of the way forums works allows me to have the upper hand in every battle I’ve ever fought, it doesn’t matter if i win them or not i still have enough experience to out-shine the person either making the accusation or being accused. Plus i don’t have to be respectful on a forum that doesn’t respect itself.

tracing a picture is copyright infringement you know, no matter its format

I am not looking for a battle with you. All I want is constructive input and instructions on how to get better at modelling. You see the pros, I’m sure you do, but where did they start? At the bottom. How can someone get better? By learning either from mistakes or other people’s advice as well as being motivated to become better. I’m at the bottom right now and I can use some guidance as well as constructive criticism. Simple really.
[/quote]
i’m not saying your models are bad, i’m saying they’re based off of someone else’s artwork, and i dont think you drew them yourself.[/quote]

No, you are right. What I’ve done with these models is I’ve taken a completely 2D image, traced the outline and I’ve stretched the faces to make the model 3D. That was the only thing I knew how to do at the time. Now I’m going to go back and do some research on how to make good models using primitives only.

Also I checked out the Blob tool and it’s really strange lol. Would be interesting to see how one could use the tool to make a good looking model.

Read full topic

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:27, topic:374668”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=470628.msg3442412#msg3442412 date=1293158443]
make your own shit? doesn’t anyone do this anymore?
[/quote]
I’m talking about which tool on Meta.[/quote]
the blob tool on meta is very interesting to play with, idk if using it would work out in the primitives situation for rsps.

[quote=“Lazyness, post:26, topic:374668”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=470628.msg3442412#msg3442412 date=1293158443]

why use blender and quit tracing shit pictures, prims are worse than tracing. Be original and come up with your own shit.

Well if you don’t use prims, and you don’t trace… what else would you do…?

make your own shit? doesn’t anyone do this anymore?

i do that and have never once traced anything…
[/quote]

How do you have a reputation like that if nothing you say is respectful? Why is tracing so bad? Yeah it’s not original but it creates cool looking items that private servers could use.

I think we’ve already got the point across that we are making our own “sh_t” now…[/quote]
my intelligence of the way forums works allows me to have the upper hand in every battle I’ve ever fought, it doesn’t matter if i win them or not i still have enough experience to out-shine the person either making the accusation or being accused. Plus i don’t have to be respectful on a forum that doesn’t respect itself.

tracing a picture is copyright infringement you know, no matter its format

Edit: I actually made a staff with all primitives not too long ago. o.O

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:21, topic:374668”]^If I could make shields like that with primitives, I sure as hell would too o_o And definitely go for making a primitive sword, they are easy for beginners to make and they usually turn out pretty good.

then of course, there is Dylan’s Enigma sword (just don’t post it in).[/quote]

The Enigma was made purely from primitives? o.O

See how the gold pieces are reflective? Is that from Specular + Power or is that a texture? I really need something like that for some of my models.

Brand New Release! 12/23/2010

why use blender and quit tracing shit pictures, prims are worse than tracing. Be original and come up with your own shit.

I use Metasequoia and it seems to work pretty well…

Prims aren’t that bad if you place them correctly.

My pieces aren’t that bad (in my opinion) so if you have nothing else to say than “You’re work is sh_t” then please find another thread to troll. You aren’t getting anywhere.

I’m going to be working on original pieces but who doesn’t want to see familiar weapons/shields?

Read full topic

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“Lazyness, post:16, topic:374668”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=470628.msg3442216#msg3442216 date=1293151480]
no downloads, looks traced, nothing special…
1/10 it’s crap.
[/quote]

  1. I’d prefer it if the models weren’t leeched so I did not post downloads.
  2. Of course it’s traced… Why do it with primitives when it could be more accurate with lines?
  3. Thanks for the trolled input? If you want to troll, RsBots has a forum full of them…

Provide more constructive criticism so I can learn… I’m brand new to this modelling stuff and I have no previous experience. I’ve taken Rip4d’s advice and I’ve tried to work more with primitives but I’m not sure I can replicate weapons using primitives (only new work from scratch).

I still need to know how to make multiple lines/vertices slope… Anyone have any idea how?[/quote]
why use blender and quit tracing shit pictures, prims are worse than tracing. Be original and come up with your own shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

^If I could make shields like that with primitives, I sure as hell would too o_o And definitely go for making a primitive sword, they are easy for beginners to make and they usually turn out pretty good.

then of course, there is Dylan’s Enigma sword (just don’t post it in).

Read full topic

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

rip4d:

I feel like my post was completely disregarded ._. Use my works as examples of what you want to achieve with primitives in Meta, they are very neat and accurate, something which lines are unable to do for most people, especially beginners.

I certainly did not disregard your post. I will definitely start working on making swords and such with primitives only. The pieces that you have made are extremely intricate and all around pleasing to look at. I’ll have to play around with the primitives a bit to make them suiting but I’m not sure that I can make already made swords come alive with primitives.

Such as this shield:

wow7.jpg550×510

If I could figure out a way to use primitives to create something like that, I totally would! But I’m not sure how I would go about doing that.

I’ll take your advice and try to create primitive only, original work.

Read full topic

item.title: Final Fantasy Swords
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Um…
http://img710.imageshack.us/img710/2021/dsr1.png
http://img685.imageshack.us/img685/9489/18608343.png
http://img641.imageshack.us/img641/359/zsaber.png
http://img23.imageshack.us/img23/6706/bitterend.png
http://img97.imageshack.us/img97/1623/icesword.png

Those are all examples of my models that I’ve made, all with primitives. It just takes practice is all. Shields can be harder, but don’t be afraid to try. Also, try to get creative with the handles, make them the central focus of the model, like these:

http://img28.imageshack.us/img28/2449/lunasolnovar2.png
http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/7318/timekeeperr1.png

Read full topic
